channel.title: Help me withz english
channel.description:
Oh Death, thou art life's last whisper.
Is death supposed to be capitalized?

item.title: Help me withz english
item.dc:creator: @icefire908 icefire908
item.description:
@icefire908 wrote:

cocoa:

It’s being referred to as a thing, not a person. Don’t capitalize it.

Mopman brings a good point, but you have to remember they use ‘Thou’ as if it was a person, i.e. The 10 Commandments.

“I believe(you don’t have to take my word for it) that it is using “Death” as a name… because it uses the pronoun “thou”. I think that “thou” is only used for people/diety.”

I’m putting correct…

Read full topic

item.title: Help me withz english
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

To be honest, that’s a very vague and silly question, it could easily go either way.

I suspect the answer they are looking for is I/incorrect, but it could really be either depending on context/how artsy the writer felt like being/what they actaully meant by death.

I’d put I, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me withz english
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

It’s being referred to as a thing, not a person. Don’t capitalize it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me withz english
item.dc:creator: @icefire908 icefire908
item.description:
@icefire908 wrote:

How do I know for sure though??

the source is from an online class

Capitalization--On your answer sheet, enter C if the sentence contains no capitalization errors and is correct. Enter I if the sentence is incorrect. You do not have to correct the sentences.

  1. “I believe you,” Dean replied, “But I can do nothing for you.”

  2. I met President Jimmy Carter on my vacation several years ago.

  3. Oh Death, thou art life’s last whisper.

  4. He volunteers at the local chapter of the red cross.

  5. We turned north toward the old church.

  6. Next year I will take History, Math, and Contemporary Literature 271.

  7. Our school sponsored a program on Veterans’ Day.

  8. I will graduate from High School in May.

  9. Last Summer I went with my Father to McCorland County Road to practice driving.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me withz english
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“icefire908, post:3, topic:289769”]"Yes, they are using Death as the character “Death”… like the guy with the scythe and the hood. "

… There’s two opinions about this…[/quote]
Then yes, capitalize it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me withz english
item.dc:creator: @icefire908 icefire908
item.description:
@icefire908 wrote:

"Yes, they are using Death as the character “Death”… like the guy with the scythe and the hood. "

… There’s two opinions about this…

Read full topic

item.title: Help me withz english
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

No, death isn’t a person’s name. Unless you’re referring to death as the Grim Reaper, then you could capitalize it.

Read full topic
